intro: Fimbristylis falcata var. falcata, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in wet or muddy soils along stream banks, marshes, and other aquatic environments.
